meanings.definition: A cord or string that is pulled to release a parachute or open a container.
meanings.sent1: The skydiver pulled the ripcords to safely land on the ground.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to always check the ripcords before jumping out of the plane.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved pulling multiple ripcords to reveal a surprise.
meanings.sent4: In times of danger, pulling the ripcords can be a lifesaving action.
meanings.sent5: The ripcords dangled from the backpack, ready to be used in case of emergency.

meanings.definition: A cord that is pulled to start a motor.
meanings.sent1: The lawnmower's ripcords were easy to pull to start the engine.
meanings.sent2: He yanked the ripcords of the generator to get it running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The old car required a strong tug on the ripcords to get it going.
meanings.sent4: The ripcords of the boat engine were frayed from frequent use.
meanings.sent5: With a quick pull of the ripcords, the motorcycle roared to life.

meanings.definition: A cord that is pulled to activate a safety mechanism.
meanings.sent1: The ripcords on the life jacket inflated it when pulled in the water.
meanings.sent2: Always keep an eye on the ripcords of the emergency brake in the car.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly pretended to pull the ripcords on her seatbelt for fun.
meanings.sent4: The ripcords on the fire extinguisher were marked clearly for easy access.
meanings.sent5: In case of an emergency, remember to pull the ripcords to trigger the alarm.
